unnormalised: The Income Tax Department has issued a reminder about linking your PAN (Permanent Account Number) with your Aadhaar number. The deadline to do so without incurring a penalty was 30/06/2023. Failure to comply now attracts a late fee, initially ₹500 and subsequently ₹1000. This linkage is crucial for seamless tax filing and processing, as per CBDT circular no. 7/2023.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has issued a reminder about linking your P-A-N (Permanent Account Number) with your Aadhaar number. The deadline to do so without incurring a penalty was thirtieth June two thousand and twenty three. Failure to comply now attracts a late fee, initially rupee five hundred and subsequently rupee one thousand. This linkage is crucial for seamless tax filing and processing, as per C-B-D-T circular number seven divided by two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: For businesses, the Goods and Services Tax Identification Number (GSTIN) is a key identifier. New businesses must register for GSTIN within 30 days of commencing operations. Existing businesses operating under a TIN (Taxpayer Identification Number) are required to migrate to the GST regime. This migration process ensures compliance with the unified indirect tax structure across India. Remember that a valid GSTIN, like 27AAACC1234A1Z0, is mandatory for inter-state transactions and claiming input tax credit.
normalised: For businesses, the Goods and Services Tax Identification Number (G-S-T-I-N) is a key identifier. New businesses must register for G-S-T-I-N within thirty days of commencing operations. Existing businesses operating under a T-I-N (Taxpayer Identification Number) are required to migrate to the G-S-T regime. This migration process ensures compliance with the unified indirect tax structure across India. Remember that a valid G-S-T-I-N, like two seven A-A-A-C-C one two three four A one Z zero, is mandatory for inter-state transactions and claiming input tax credit.

unnormalised: The Corporate Identification Number (CIN) is another crucial identifier, particularly for companies registered under the Companies Act, 2013. A CIN, such as U72200MH2005PLC154321, uniquely identifies each company and is required for all filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA). This number assists in tracking the company's legal and financial activities and ensures transparency in corporate governance.
normalised: The Corporate Identification Number (C-I-N) is another crucial identifier, particularly for companies registered under the Companies Act, two thousand and thirteen. A C-I-N, such as U seven two two zero zero M-H two zero zero five P-L-C one five four three two one, uniquely identifies each company and is required for all filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (M-C-A). This number assists in tracking the company's legal and financial activities and ensures transparency in corporate governance.

unnormalised: Entities involved in import-export activities must obtain an Importer-Exporter Code (IEC). This is a 10-digit code issued by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT). The IEC is essential for customs clearance and foreign trade transactions. An example of an IEC is 0512345678. Obtaining and maintaining these identifiers accurately are critical for regulatory compliance and smooth business operations in India.
normalised: Entities involved in import-export activities must obtain an Importer-Exporter Code (I-E-C). This is a ten-digit code issued by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (D-G-F-T). The I-E-C is essential for customs clearance and foreign trade transactions. An example of an I-E-C is zero five one two three four five six seven eight. Obtaining and maintaining these identifiers accurately are critical for regulatory compliance and smooth business operations in India.
